306571.「これが キリカの草餅……。\n ずいぶんと 大きいですが 香りは\n お師匠様:
These are Kirika Dumplings. They are quite
large, but the aroma is just like the
Kusamochi that Master made for me.

306573.「これは……間違いありません。 \n かつて ヤマカミヌで お師匠様が私に\n:
There is no doubt about it.It tastes just like
the Kusamochi that the master used to make for
me at Yamakaminu.

306574.「草餅を たくさん作りました。\n 日持ちするので 戦場に 持っていきなさい。:
I made a lot of rice cakes. They will last for
a long time, so take them to the battlefield.

306576.「……ひとりで 災厄の王へ挑むのですね。:
You are taking on the King of Calamity by
yourself.

306577.「……もう 共に戦ったあいつは いませんから。: He who fought with us is no longer with us.

306578.「私の友プクラスが 災厄の王から生き残るため\n 脱出計画を 指揮しています。\:
My friend Pukulas is leading an escape plan to
survive the King of Calamity. Please evacuate
with Pukulas, Master.

306579.「こんな時に 私の心配など無用ですよ。:
You don't need to worry about me at a time
like this.

306580.「私は この地に残ります。\n そして 取りのこされた人々を集めて\n チカラを:
I will remain here. And I will gather the
survivors and join forces with them to
survive.

306581.「ふふ……。\n その草餅が 何という草から作られているか\n あなたに 話した:
Hmm. Did I ever tell you what kind of grass
those grass cakes are made from?

306582.「いえ……ないと思います。: I don't think I can say that.

306583.「その草餅は ニガユリという草から\n 作られているんです。ニガユリ草は\n ど:
Bitter Lily Grass is a strong grass that can
take root anywhere.

306584.「国が滅びようと 私も ニガユリ草のように\n 何としても 生き抜いてみせます。:
Even if my country perishes, I, like Bitter Lily Grass, will do whatever it takes to survive. Therefore, you should fight without
worrying.

306585.「あなたは 子供の頃から 私の草餅が\n 大好きでしたね。:
You have loved my grass cakes since you were a
child.

306586.「その草餅が 少しでもあなたのチカラに\n なりますよう 武運を 祈っています。:
I wish you good luck and hope that the rice
cakes will be a source of strength for you.

306587.「お師匠様……。\n 今まで ありがとうございました。:
Master. Thank you for all you have done for
me.

306588.「とても……懐かしい味です。\n まさか お師匠様の草餅が食べられるなんて\n:
It tastes very nostalgic. I never thought I
would be able to eat Master's Kusamochi.

306589.「私の国は滅びても 私達の生きた証は\n ６０００年の時を超え 今の人々に\n:
My country may have perished, but the proof of
our life has transcended 6,000 years and is
being passed on to the people of today.

306591.「この草餅のおかげで 考えが変わりました。\n 私は 何としても この戦いを生き:
This rice cake has changed my mind. I will do
everything in my power to survive this battle
and fulfill my promise to Kourin.

306592.「イヨリ大僧正様。\n わざわざ キリカの草餅を作ってくださって\n ありがとう:
Dear High Priest Iyori Thank you very much for
taking the trouble to make Kirika Dumplings.

306593.「<pc>さん あなたと地上に来られて\n 本当によかった。おかげで戦いへの覚悟:
<pc> I am so glad to have come to
earth with you. Thanks to you, I'm ready for
battle, and now let's go back to Heaven.
